problem_statement: Given an undirected connected graph with n nodes and a list of edges, identify all critical connections (bridges) whose removal increases the number of connected components. Return each edge as [u, v] with u < v and sort the result first by smaller node index, then by larger. Use Tarjanâ€™s algorithm: maintain discovery times disc[u] and low-link values low[u] to detect bridges. Correct low-link updates are crucial: for child v, use low[u] = min(low[u], low[v]); for back edges, use low[u] = min(low[u], disc[v]).
